wikipedia_page.main:
Sir Percy Henry Winfield  (16 September 1878 – 7 July 1953) was Rouse Ball Professor of English Law between 1928 and 1943. He was born at Stoke Ferry in Norfolk. He died at his home at 13 Cranmer Road in Cambridge. He was married to Lady Helena Winfield, née Scruby (1887 - 1954). He was a fellow of St John's College, Cambridge.
He was the author of The Chief Sources of English Legal History.

response: English legal scholar Percy Henry Winfield summarized much of the literature by observing that:
* Percy Henry Winfield, professor of law
* Sir Percy Henry Winfield FBA, Rouse Ball Professor of English Law, Fellow of St John's College, Cambridge, author of The Law of Torts and his wife Lady Helena Winfield, née Scruby

link_mentions.page: The Chief Sources of English Legal History
response: The Chief Sources of English Legal History is a book written by Percy Henry Winfield and published, with an introduction by Roscoe Pound, by Harvard University Press in 1925. It is "bright and lively",McMurray, Orin Kip. "Book Reviews" (1927) 15 California Law Review 179. JSTOR. "eminently readable",Schuyler, R L (1926) 26 Columbia Law Review 249 and 250. JSTOR "admirable"Cross, Arthur Lyon. "Book Reviews" (1926) 24 Michigan Law Review 320. JSTOR. and of "great value and usefulness".Hicks, Frederick C. "Book Reviews" (1926) 35 Yale Law Journal 894. JSTOR.
*Percy Henry Winfield, KC, LLD, FBA, JP, Emeritus Professor of English Law, University of Cambridge.
